intro: Echidnopsis chrysantha subsp. chrysantha, commonly known as the golden chrysantha, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its compact, succulent growth habit and produces vibrant yellow flowers during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and requires minimal water, making it well-suited for arid environments. Its unique morphology and ornamental value make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
